column4: Could anyone here help me with this error?  "An error occurred while attempting to read the boot configuration" - something to do with \boot\bcd.
when are you getting that error and what are you doing?

The story goes like this:  1 drive with fubared Vista...  I shrank it and made two partitions.  I had broken vista, but could not install ubuntu (no video after i asked it to start without making changes), so i put on win 7.  That worked fine, but then I removed the old partition and grew win 7 to fill the drive.  Now I'm getting this error...
you getting the error booting windows 7?
are you trying to dualboot windows 7 and ubuntu?
i would love to, but i can' get ubuntu on the computer... and now i can't even get win 7 to boot
ahh so windows 7 boot loader is fubar'd.  Try booting the 7 cd and see if they have a fixmbr option like xp/vista etc...
hold up let me find you direcitons
that will allow you to get windows 7 to boot then you'll have to look at fixing wubi. I don't think it installs grub it just modifies windows bootloader
that will allow you to get windows 7 to boot then you'll have to look at fixing wubi. I don't think it installs grub it just modifies windows bootloader
wth it didn't post the link hold up
i've already done that and more (the link I posted:  http://neosmart.net/wiki/display/EBCD/Recovering+the+Vista+Bootloader+from+the+DVD )
